title: Jane Seymour, 68, reveals she looks too young to land mature roles
text:
She's famed for her stunning, youthful appearance.

Yet Jane Seymour has revealed that her looks can work against her as she struggles to land older roles.

The former Bond girl, 68, said she has had to convince producers that she can do ‘old and gnarly', in order to get a diverse range of parts.

Youthful: She's famed for her stunning, youthful appearance. Yet Jane Seymour has revealed that her looks can work against her as she struggles to land older roles

‘I’ll take all my make-up off and they’ll see I can do “old” quite well,’ she told Hello! magazine. ‘My intention is to age as gracefully as I can.

‘Inside, I’m 20 years old. I was way too serious when I was that age. I’ve found my 20-year-old alter ego, it just happens to be in this body. But that’s okay. I’m having fun and I love it.’

Jane credited her enviable physique with pilates, walking and light weightlifting as well as a healthy diet that excludes sugar and fried foods.

She said that a ‘naughty night’ usually consists of ‘a handful of pistachios, two pieces of very dark chocolate and a glass of wine.’

Stunning: The former Bond girl, 68, said she has had to convince producers that she can do ‘old and gnarly', in order to get a diverse range of parts (pictured in July)

Throwback: Jane is most famous for her role as Bond girl Solitaire in 1973's Live And Let Die and she has barely aged a day since then with her youthful appearance

Last year, Jane said that she was hesitant to have too much cosmetic surgery on her face as she wouldn’t be able to show emotion on screen.

‘I need my face to move, if it doesn’t move, I can’t play the characters. I’m pretty comfortable in my own skin,’ she said on Loose Women.

‘I got my breasts done because of the pressure of losing my marriage, I thought maybe that’s what I should do. I had the vacant space filled. If I want to look younger on screen, I sometimes tape my neck or wear a wig.’

Jane also told Closer magazine recently that she only feels better with age.

She explained: 'I still feel sexy. I don't do Botox and I'm happy to fly the flag for older women,' said the former Bond girl.

Out now: Read the full interview in this week's edition of Hello magazine

'I've got plenty of wrinkles though. In fact, I'm playing a woman in her 70s right now in The Kominsky Method, so I wear a grey wig and have all my wrinkles showing. I'm very happy to do so.'

Meanwhile, Jane, who has been married and divorced four times, is currently in a relationship with 70-year-old British director David Green.

But despite walking down the aisle four times, she has insisted that she won’t be tying the knot for a fifth time.

‘At the moment I don’t see any reason to get married again. I’ve been there, done that. And I’m very happy,’ she told Hello.

Jane split from her fourth husband, actor and producer James Keach, in 2013 after 20 years of marriage.

She was first married to theatre director Michael Attenborough from 1971 to 1973 and then to Attenborough’s friend Geoffrey Planer from 1977 to 1978.

Her third husband was David Flynn, who she wed in 1981 before divorcing in 1992.
